page.title: 05INTERVIEW: DOUNBY HOTELIER
page.content: Mr. & Mrs. Mowat have owned the Smithfield for four years. There are a lounge bar, public bar and seven guest rooms. In the{hotel}there are ten employees who help with meals and behind the bar. Mrs. Mowat usually gets up at seven o' clock. Once she has started making breakfast she gets the children up for school. At half past eight the guests come down for breakfast and then it is time to tidy up. She then starts to prepare the dinners and begins serving these at half past twelve. The evening meals are at half past six and she is usually ready for bed by ten o' clock. During the week the busiest times are Friday to Sunday with the most hectic months being May to September. Mrs. Mowat likes living in Dounby as she enjoys the work and meeting so many new people.
